result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Dee Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Obtain GED or HSED.

No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No illegally controlled substances.
AODA, evaluation programs or treatment as recommended.  Random screening.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant he cannot possess  firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within five (5) years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a three (3) year mandatory Initial Confinement.

Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge.
Pay fine of $80.00 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid  by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Dee Rivera

records.addlTxt: 3/10/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, evaluation programs or treatment as recommended; 4) no illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening; 6) seek and maintain employment; 7) obtain GED or HSED.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Jason Dee Rivera in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Jason Dee Rivera in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel, Shirley R. and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 7 years with 10 days credit -  consecutive to 14cf2829 - INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 4 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 3 years; pay a fine of $80 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Defendant Jason Dee Rivera in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Jason Dee Rivera in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds


Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 1 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Requested Jury Instructions and Instructions received and filed./ds

Defendant to be produced from Waukesha for both dates.

Defendant Jason Dee Rivera in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Jason Dee Rivera in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.   Court reviews the motion and brief and orders the cases joined for jury trial.  Defense states there are no motions besides a standard motion in limine.   Court orders motions to be filed 14 days prior to final pretrial.  State withdraws consent to consolidate these cases with the Waukesha case.  State is revoking offer made to not file additional charges and no further offer will be made to the defendant.  Court orders additional charges to be filed by 2-12-16.  Attorneys have jury trials set on this date.  Court sets this case as a back up case.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea Hearing on Friday, January 29, 2016 at 1:30 PM in BR 44, SB Rm 316 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Attorney Eamon Collins Guerin in court, defendant Jason Dee Rivera not in court, in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant is in custody in Waukesha facing a homicide charge.  Discussion held in chambers with the Court.  Case is to be set for change of plea.  If matters can be consolidated in Waukesha before that date, this case can be removed from the calendar.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eamon Collins Guerin in court, defendant Jason Dee Rivera not in court, in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant was not produced from Waukesha County for today's date and will not be produced on Monday for the jury trial date due to hearings in Waukesha.  State advises the Court this case may be consolidated with the Waukesha cases.  Court cancels the jury trial.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Dee Rivera in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Jason Dee Rivera in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties were trying to resolve case with a global offer with defendant's cases in Waukesha.  However, defendant just received discovery in that case on 11-16-15 with a next date of 1-14-16.    State objects.  Court will set cases for final pretrial and jury trial.  Cases had been previously been joined for jury trial.  Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Attorneys have jury trials set on 1-11-16.  Court sets these cases as a back-up cases.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jason Dee Rivera in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has a pending case in Waukesha County. Defense requesting this case be transferred to Waukesha County for purposes of a global resolution. The State does not object as long as the case in Waukesha County moves swiftly in a timely manner. Court does not object subject to the Waukesha case moves along and Waukesha County approves the transfer.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Dee Rivera in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia Daugherty.
Case set for oral ruling.  Defense counsel is requesting an oral ruling.  He withdraws motion previously filed.  Case remains scheduled for trial and final pretrial.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw

Defense counsel wants cases set for trial.  Defense thought defendant's cases were unjoined.  Court granted cases to be joined together previously, and will put a full record on the next court date. Defendant Jason Dee Rivera in court pro se.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify for Public defender representation however, one has not yet been appointed.   The public defender's office was notified and will have counsel appointed by next hearing.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 3.  Status conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel is requesting to withdraw for reasons stated on the record.  Defendant is not working, and will qualify for a public defender.  Attorney Meylink will turn his file over to the public defender's office.  Defendant to go to the public defender's office and get evaluated.  Parties advised as of August 1, case will be assigned to Judge Konkol, branch 44.  Defendant has 10 days to file.
Case passed.
